trans-unit.source: Errors from Secured Resources
trans-unit.target: Errors from Secured Resources

trans-unit.source: Errors from Secured Resources
trans-unit.target: Errors from Secured Resources

trans-unit.source: This section describes the errors that a secured resource, such as a web API returns when the web API implements RFC 6750.
trans-unit.target: This section describes the errors that a secured resource, such as a web API returns when the web API implements RFC 6750.

trans-unit.source: In addition, it includes information to help your web application authenticate to a service that is secured by Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).
trans-unit.target: In addition, it includes information to help your web application authenticate to a service that is secured by Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the RFC 6750 specification, <externalLink><linkText>The OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework: Bearer Token Usage</linkText><linkUri>http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6750</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the RFC 6750 specification, <externalLink><linkText>The OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework: Bearer Token Usage</linkText><linkUri>http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6750</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Secured resources that implement RFC 6750 issue HTTP status codes.
trans-unit.target: Secured resources that implement RFC 6750 issue HTTP status codes.

trans-unit.source: If the request does not include authentication credentials or is missing the token, the response includes an "WWW-Authenticate" header.
trans-unit.target: If the request does not include authentication credentials or is missing the token, the response includes an "WWW-Authenticate" header.

trans-unit.source: When a request fails, the resource server responds with the an HTTP status code and an error code.
trans-unit.target: When a request fails, the resource server responds with the an HTTP status code and an error code.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example of an unsuccessful request and response.
trans-unit.target: Here is an example of an unsuccessful request and response.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the client request does not have the required bearer token.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the client request does not have the required bearer token.

trans-unit.source: In the response from the resource, the HTTP 401 status code indicates the authorization failed.
trans-unit.target: In the response from the resource, the HTTP 401 status code indicates the authorization failed.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>invalid_token</parameterReference> error code and error description explain the specific problem.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>invalid_token</parameterReference> error code and error description explain the specific problem.

trans-unit.source: HTTP Status Codes
trans-unit.target: HTTP Status Codes

trans-unit.source: The following status codes are used in responses to requests for secured resources.
trans-unit.target: The following status codes are used in responses to requests for secured resources.

trans-unit.source: HTTP Code
trans-unit.target: HTTP Code

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Default HTTP code.
trans-unit.target: Default HTTP code.

trans-unit.source: Used in most cases.
trans-unit.target: Used in most cases.

trans-unit.source: Authentication failed.
trans-unit.target: Authentication failed.

trans-unit.source: For example, the request the request contains an expired access token.
trans-unit.target: For example, the request the request contains an expired access token.

trans-unit.source: Authorization failed.
trans-unit.target: Authorization failed.

trans-unit.source: For example, the user does not have permission to access the resource.
trans-unit.target: For example, the user does not have permission to access the resource.

trans-unit.source: An internal error has occurred at the service.
trans-unit.target: An internal error has occurred at the service.

trans-unit.source: Retry the request.
trans-unit.target: Retry the request.

trans-unit.source: Error Parameters
trans-unit.target: Error Parameters

trans-unit.source: The following table shows the parameters in the error response.
trans-unit.target: The following table shows the parameters in the error response.

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: authorization_uri
trans-unit.target: authorization_uri

trans-unit.source: The URI (physical endpoint) of the authorization server.
trans-unit.target: The URI (physical endpoint) of the authorization server.

trans-unit.source: This value is also used as a lookup key to get more information about the server from a discovery endpoint.
trans-unit.target: This value is also used as a lookup key to get more information about the server from a discovery endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The client must validate that the authorization server is trusted.
trans-unit.target: The client must validate that the authorization server is trusted.

trans-unit.source: When the resource is protected by Azure AD, it is sufficient to verify that the URL begins with https://login.windows.net or another hostname that Azure AD supports.
trans-unit.target: When the resource is protected by Azure AD, it is sufficient to verify that the URL begins with https://login.windows.net or another hostname that Azure AD supports.

trans-unit.source: A tenant-specific resource should always return a tenant-specific authorization URI.
trans-unit.target: A tenant-specific resource should always return a tenant-specific authorization URI.

trans-unit.source: error
trans-unit.target: error

trans-unit.source: An error code value defined in Section 5.2 of the <externalLink><linkText>OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework</linkText><linkUri>http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: An error code value defined in Section 5.2 of the <externalLink><linkText>OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework</linkText><linkUri>http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The next table describes the error codes that Azure AD returns.
trans-unit.target: The next table describes the error codes that Azure AD returns.

trans-unit.source: error_description
trans-unit.target: error_description

trans-unit.source: A more detailed description of the error.
trans-unit.target: A more detailed description of the error.

trans-unit.source: This message is not intended to be end-user friendly.
trans-unit.target: This message is not intended to be end-user friendly.

trans-unit.source: resource_id
trans-unit.target: resource_id

trans-unit.source: Returns the unique identifier of the resource.
trans-unit.target: Returns the unique identifier of the resource.

trans-unit.source: The client application can use this identifier as the value of the <parameterReference>resource</parameterReference> parameter when it requests a token for the resource.
trans-unit.target: The client application can use this identifier as the value of the <parameterReference>resource</parameterReference> parameter when it requests a token for the resource.

trans-unit.source: The client application must verify the value.
trans-unit.target: The client application must verify the value.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, a malicious service might be able to induce an elevation-of-privileges attack.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, a malicious service might be able to induce an elevation-of-privileges attack.

trans-unit.source: The recommended strategy for preventing an attack is to verify that the <parameterReference>resource_id</parameterReference> matches the base of the web API URL that being accessed.
trans-unit.target: The recommended strategy for preventing an attack is to verify that the <parameterReference>resource_id</parameterReference> matches the base of the web API URL that being accessed.

trans-unit.source: For example, if <parameterReference>https://service.contoso.com/data</parameterReference> is being accessed, the <parameterReference>resource_id</parameterReference> can be <parameterReference>htttps://service.contoso.com/</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: For example, if <parameterReference>https://service.contoso.com/data</parameterReference> is being accessed, the <parameterReference>resource_id</parameterReference> can be <parameterReference>htttps://service.contoso.com/</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: The client application must reject a <parameterReference>resource_id</parameterReference> that does not begin with the base URL unless there is a reliable alternate way to verify the id.
trans-unit.target: The client application must reject a <parameterReference>resource_id</parameterReference> that does not begin with the base URL unless there is a reliable alternate way to verify the id.

trans-unit.source: Bearer Scheme Error Codes
trans-unit.target: Bearer Scheme Error Codes

trans-unit.source: The RFC 6750 specification defines the following errors for resources that use using the WWW-Authenticate header and Bearer scheme in the response.
trans-unit.target: The RFC 6750 specification defines the following errors for resources that use using the WWW-Authenticate header and Bearer scheme in the response.

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the HTTP status code and error codes that can appear in the response.
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the HTTP status code and error codes that can appear in the response.

trans-unit.source: HTTP Code: Error_Code
trans-unit.target: HTTP Code: Error_Code

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Client Action
trans-unit.target: Client Action

trans-unit.source: 400: invalid_request
trans-unit.target: 400: invalid_request

trans-unit.source: The request is not well-formed.
trans-unit.target: The request is not well-formed.

trans-unit.source: For example, it might be missing a parameter or using the same parameter twice.
trans-unit.target: For example, it might be missing a parameter or using the same parameter twice.

trans-unit.source: Fix the error and retry the request.
trans-unit.target: Fix the error and retry the request.

trans-unit.source: This type of error should occur only during development and be detected in initial testing.
trans-unit.target: This type of error should occur only during development and be detected in initial testing.

trans-unit.source: 401: invalid_token
trans-unit.target: 401: invalid_token

trans-unit.source: The access token is missing, invalid, or is revoked.
trans-unit.target: The access token is missing, invalid, or is revoked.

trans-unit.source: The value of the <parameterReference>error_description</parameterReference> parameter provides additional detail.
trans-unit.target: The value of the <parameterReference>error_description</parameterReference> parameter provides additional detail.

trans-unit.source: Request a new token from the authorization server.
trans-unit.target: Request a new token from the authorization server.

trans-unit.source: If the new token fails, an unexpected error has occurred.
trans-unit.target: If the new token fails, an unexpected error has occurred.

trans-unit.source: Send an error message to the user and retry after random delays.
trans-unit.target: Send an error message to the user and retry after random delays.

trans-unit.source: 403: insufficient_scope
trans-unit.target: 403: insufficient_scope

trans-unit.source: The access token does not contain the impersonation permissions required to access the resource.
trans-unit.target: The access token does not contain the impersonation permissions required to access the resource.

trans-unit.source: Send a new authorization request to the authorization endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Send a new authorization request to the authorization endpoint.

trans-unit.source: If the response contains the <parameterReference>scope</parameterReference> parameter, use the scope value in the request to the resource.
trans-unit.target: If the response contains the <parameterReference>scope</parameterReference> parameter, use the scope value in the request to the resource.

trans-unit.source: 403: insufficient_access
trans-unit.target: 403: insufficient_access

trans-unit.source: The subject of the token does not have the permissions that are required to access the resource.
trans-unit.target: The subject of the token does not have the permissions that are required to access the resource.

trans-unit.source: Prompt the user to use a different account or to request permissions to the specified resource.
trans-unit.target: Prompt the user to use a different account or to request permissions to the specified resource.

trans-unit.source: Here is another example of a problematic request and its error response.
trans-unit.target: Here is another example of a problematic request and its error response.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the client application has an access token, but it is expired.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the client application has an access token, but it is expired.

trans-unit.source: The response uses the HTTP 401 status code and error and error_description parameters to describe the error.
trans-unit.target: The response uses the HTTP 401 status code and error and error_description parameters to describe the error.
